channel.title: A problem with this webpage caused Internet Explorer to close and reopen the tab
channel.description:
There was an earlier discussion of this but no one ever had an answer and so I thought I'd open a new discussion.
This did not used to happen, and it does not happen on my other computer, however, whenever I go to www.moparisthebest.com (the home page) IE 9 reports the following:
"A problem with this webpage caused Internet Explorer to close and reopen the tab." And I'm staring at a blank screen.
When I do the same in Firefox--just go to www.moparisthebest.com -- Firefox promptly quits, closing ALL tabs (no matter how many I have open) in the process, without even an error message.
I have the latest Java. I have the latest updates on IE9 and the latest version of Firefox. They're BOTH doing it. I'm on Windows 7 Ultimate.
I've tried clearing the browser caches, that doesn't do anything. Does anyone else know what might cause something like this?

item.title: A problem with this webpage caused Internet Explorer to close and reopen the tab
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:6, topic:407510”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=508799.msg3691345#msg3691345 date=1312148896]

The webclient does not run on your computers Java, so you do not need java installed to run a webclient. Try deleting your cache in the C: drive.

Yes it does? Whenever I run it the Java process starts in the background.
[/quote]
That’s because it has to run Java, but you do not need it downloaded to use it… I didn’t have Java download for a year, and I could play tons of webclients with no problems.[/quote]

I’m not sure how that would work. Runescape itself requires Java, and it’s only a webclient, plus webclients are Jars from my knowledge.

Read full topic
item.source: A problem with this webpage caused Internet Explorer to close and reopen the tab
